> With JUnit 3.x, where we have to inherit from TestCase to make test
case 
> classes, I do this:
> 
>   * A implements X, Y, Z, so I have....
>   * XTestTemplate, YTestTemplate, ZTestTemplate for my contract tests
>   * AAsXTest extends XTestTemplate
>   * AAsYTest extends YTestTemplate
>   * AAsZTest extends ZTestTemplate
>   * ATest for all other A-specific tests
> 
> With JUnit 4, where we no longer have to inherit from TestCase to make 
> test case classes, we might be able to do something better. Once I have 
> JDK 5, I can try it and see.
> 
> I hope this helps.

It does help! A lot...

Boy do I feel stupid.

All this time I was trying to make everything fit into one class when
all it took was testing all aspects separately (which is a good
practice anyway). I'll have to remember to switch point of views more
often...

Thank you very much for taking some time to answer my questions!

Dimitri

PS: This must be the nicest forum/mailing list/community I've ever set
foot into (and I've already received two answers from web
celebrities...w00t).
